items.title: Welcome Christmas rain in the outback while south-east Queensland will be sweltering
items.summary: A tropical low will bring heavy rain and storms to much of Queensland this week while a south-east heatwave persists.

items.title: Federal government announces 2027 gas reservation scheme, ASX rallies — as it happened
items.summary: The federal government announced its intention to start a gas reservation scheme from 2027. The ASX made a strong start to the shortened trading week.

items.title: Christmas bonuses boost staff morale, but employers facing 'tighter margins' may struggle to give
items.summary: From hams to vouchers and cash, festive bonuses vary — but do they still have a place in the Australian workforce?

items.title: Given the all clear from cancer, 6yo Laylah celebrates by ringing the bell at the Queensland Children's Hospital
items.summary: When six-year-old Laylah-Jane Morton rang the bell at the Queensland Children's Hospital, it marked the end of her chemotherapy treatment for blood cancer — and she had her merry band of eight siblings with her to help her celebrate.

items.title: How domestic violence offenders use the court system to inflict more pain
items.summary: Jessica Seage fought for six years for the man who raped her to be convicted. Experts say her experience is a stark example of how perpetrators abuse the system to inflict more pain on their victims.

items.title: Long-awaited wine industry mandatory code of conduct too late for growers
items.summary: After 20 years, three senate inquiries and an independent review, the sale of wine grapes will be regulated by a mandatory code of conduct, but growers say it might be too late.

items.title: US says it is intercepting third Venezuelan oil tanker amid simmering tensions
items.summary: If successful, it would be the third oil tanker seized as Donald Trump continues his campaign on President Nicolas Maduro.

items.title: England's Bazballers finally admit they've got things wrong in this Ashes series
items.summary: Losing an Ashes Test series in Australia is nothing new for England, but finally the Bazballers are looking inwards at their own failings after a stirring end to the Adelaide Test.

items.title: Insolvent business run by former AFL star wipes its debt of millions, and the taxpayer is left to foot the bill
items.summary: A digital marketing agency run by a former AFL star has wiped its millions in debt through an insolvency process, only to open under a new ABN days later. Former staff were left without a job and almost $450,000 in unpaid entitlements, but it's within the bounds of the law and leaves taxpayers footing the bill.

items.title: Doctors delay surgery for patients on GLP-1 drugs like Ozempic over increased risk of pulmonary aspiration
items.summary: Doctors say they are forced to delay some procedures due to the risk of serious consequences for patients on Ozempic-like drugs.

items.title: Calls for gun law reform clash with gun lobby resistance
items.summary: Straight-pull rapid-fire rifles, social media campaigns, and a looming buyback scheme – Australia's gun debate is reloading.

items.title: What we do and don't know about the Bondi gunmen's month in the Philippines
items.summary: The long shadow of the Bondi shooting has darkened the coastal southern Philippines, causing deep confusion and stoking long-held anxieties over terrorist groups in the region.

items.title: Staff at Melbourne building company say wages went unpaid as employer threw lavish parties
items.summary: Since 2017, Melbourne building boss Mike Harris has overseen four company collapses. Left behind are clients who have lost their life savings and staff who couldn't pay their mortgages.

items.title: Here's what defined Australian politics in 2025
items.summary: The ABC's political reporters, commentators and broadcasters reflect on what defined the year in politics.

items.title: Is 2025 ending with an AI bubble? We could be at a turning point in history
items.summary: What makes the AI-driven stock market bubble unique in history is that if it's not a bubble, the impact on humanity could be far more challenging than any previous technology.

items.title: Nine killed, 10 wounded in South African pub shooting

items.summary: In the pre-series furore, with England crowing and injury concerns mounting, Australia stayed quiet. Its response has been an emphatic and quite brilliant Ashes domination.

items.title: Nathan Lyon's hamstring, Marnus Labuschagne's hands and Jamie Smith's hack — quick hits from day five of third Ashes Test
items.summary: Jamie Smith is pilloried as "a dope" after an ugly dismissal as Nathan Lyon is injured and Marnus Labuschagne creates more catching magic. Here are the quick hits from day five of the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

items.title: How staying quiet led Pluribus to be one of the most talked about shows of 2025
items.summary: Pluribus, the new show from Breaking Bad and Better Call Saul creator Vince Gilligan, presents a life of perfect harmony — all you have to do is give up your individuality.

items.title: How a Reddit tip proved vital for uncovering the suspect of the Brown University shooting
items.summary: On December 13 a gunman killed two Brown University students and wounded nine others, escaping by foot.

items.summary: Police are appealing for information after a woman was allegedly assaulted in broad daylight on a popular Gold Coast walking track.

items.title: Nathan Lyon injured on fifth day of Adelaide Test as England hunt a miracle to keep Ashes series alive
items.summary: The 38-year-old spinner pulls up lame after diving to save a boundary in the morning session of the fifth day of the third Ashes Test at Adelaide Oval.

items.title: Australian 15-year-old Indra Brown claims World Cup silver in the freeski halfpipe

items.title: NT government pulls funding for puberty blockers, gender-affirming hormones for children
items.summary: Northern Territory Health Minister Steve Edgington announces the withdrawal of public funding for puberty blockers and hormone treatments for children, labelling them "dangerous, ideologically driven practices".

items.title: Agnes Water Museum says it houses a 100-year-old orange in its collection

items.summary: After hearing harrowing stories of abuse against young Nepalese women and girls, Port Macquarie man Ross Nancarrow wanted to help.

items.title: Approaching her 80th birthday, Joan Jeffery is still riding high
items.summary: While many people entering their 80s are struggling with physical or mental limitations, Joan Jeffery still manages to do all the heavy lifting of caring for a horse.

items.title: Paraplegic engineer becomes the first wheelchair user to blast into space
items.summary: The flight was just 10 minutes but the capsule still managed to soar 105 kilometres up, skimming into space.

items.summary: For photographer Scott Jon McCook, seeing the unique salt lakes of WA's Wheatbelt from the air was so captivating it started a five-year passion project.

items.summary: Ben Stokes laments the end of England's Ashes "dream" as Australia wins the third Test by 82 runs on a surprisingly tense final day to take an unassailable 3-0 series lead.

items.title: Alice Springs program Bikes Mwerre marks four years of after-school riding, learning
items.summary: An Alice Springs teenager who grew up with cycling program Bikes Mwerre is now sharing his knowledge with the next generation. It's a full-circle moment for the outback program built on pride, skills and belonging.

items.title: Vanuatu nationals celebrate faith and friendship in Bundaberg under the PALM scheme
items.summary: Moving to another country to provide for your family is not an easy choice but singing, hugs and faith make it easier for these Pacific island workers.

items.title: Pilbara mining towns left out of government's battery rebate schemes

items.title: Bondi Beach shooting: Thousands at Bondi mark a week since terror attack; Albanese booed by angry crowd — as it happened
items.summary: Thousands of people heard messages of defiance and resilience, along with calls for “light, love and unity”, as they gathered at Bondi Beach to mark one week since the devastating terrorist attack. Look back on how events unfolded.

items.title: 'Dead zones' prompt tour operator Pennicott to fund marine study of D'Entrecasteaux Channel
items.summary: For more than two decades, Rob Pennicott has taken tourists to see the D'Entrecasteaux Channel. But what he describes as "dead zones" have him so worried that he is funding a study to find what is going wrong.

items.title: Limited options for people trying to donate blood in regional NSW in wake of Bondi terror attack
items.summary: Residents in parts of regional NSW could be left waiting months to give blood, with limited donation options available.

items.title: Temporary recreational fishing restrictions eased amid SA's algal bloom

items.title: The fight to save Australia's beaches from coastal erosion

items.summary: A new exhibition highlights the women behind acclaimed Australian mid-century artist Arthur Boyd, bringing their overlooked stories and art practices to the fore.

items.summary: White western grey kangaroos are a popular sight in a small wildlife park nestled near the South Australia – Victoria border and some are now being sold.

items.title: How 3D movie animation technology is helping injured athletes
items.summary: The reasons for high rates of serious knee injuries among female athletes are not fully understood.

items.summary: Who'd have guessed a South Korean man doing a goofy horse dance was a recipe for a global phenomenon? Thirteen years after it made YouTube history we revisit the legacy of Psy's Gangnam Style.

items.title: With heads bowed after the Bondi terror attack, now is the time to listen to the Jewish community
items.summary: If we are to inch towards unity, the more we pause to listen, the more sure-footed our path forward will be.

items.title: England abandons Bazball but is still no match for Australia with Ashes triumph imminent
items.summary: England's belated abandonment of Bazball gives it temporary life, but reveals a painful truth — no version of this team is a match for the soon-to-be victorious Australians.

items.summary: Australia finishes day four needing four wickets to reclaim the Ashes thanks to Marnus Labuschagne and Nathan Lyon. Here are the quick hits from day four of the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

items.title: Vanuatu continues to rebuild one year after devastating earthquake
items.summary: Tourists are returning to Vanuatu a year on from a major catastrophe. But many demolished buildings are yet to be rebuilt and some locals are frustrated with the pace of repairs.

items.title: Why new Perth Glory coach Adam Griffiths might be Australian football's most interesting character
items.summary: In a team struggling to retain fans, in a league battling for attention, newly appointed Perth Glory coach Adam Griffiths may just be the man with the answers for both problems.

items.title: NT housing market continues to grow as house prices climb across cities
items.summary: First home buyers are being priced out of the Darwin property market by interstate investors looking to cash in on high rental yields, with many properties sold without even being listed.
